website_summaries.verdict: Pebble's step-up all-steel smartwatch has added battery life and a more durable feel, but it's basically a tiny upgrade to the less expensive Pebble Time.
pros: boosted battery life should last over a week
works with iPhone and Android phones
cons: Design doesn't look much different than the less-expensive non-steel Pebble Time
fitness tracking is less accurate than rival wearables

customer_reviews.title: A great smartwatch. Its built well
customer_reviews.text: A great smartwatch. Its built well, looks nice, reads notifications and has some really fun watch faces. Its also waterproof and has long battery life. What more do you need in a watch? It has the neat Timeline feature built in to help manage your day. I have other smartwatches that are nice such as LG Urbane. It looks great and takes advantage of other features that this one doesn't have but as a daily driver I will be wearing this one. I'm happy so far with this watch. Update: I've added another pic with the truffol steel black band installed
customer_reviews.author: Michael Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: This watch isn't perfect, but it's affordable and functional (I'm using it ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch isn't perfect, but it's affordable and functional (I'm using it with an iPhone 6). Features that I enjoy: - Step tracking - Sleep tracking - Push notifications (calls, text previews, calendar alerts, Instagram notifications, etc.) - Run keeper app integration (super awesome to be able to look at my wrist during a run and see mileage/pace/time) - Music controls (change tracks, pause, and adjust volume for Apple Music, Spotify, etc.) - Third party apps - Tons of watchfaces with different designs and functionalities (my current one displays time, date, weather, battery %)
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: No customer support has me tentative to buy again after last two didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: I love my old Pebble and when my Pebble round conked out after just 7 months I was disapppointed but went right ahead and bought a new one. It arrived and the watch face was frozen so I looked at postings and reset to factory. Now it won't turn on at all and is completely frozen. I am sending it back as there is not any customer support since Fitbit bought Pebble. I want to buy another Pebble but don't know if there is anyway to get some support or if it is worth taking a chance again. Aargh! I have been a big Pebble fan and am sad to be in this spot.
customer_reviews.author: Alastair W Palmer

customer_reviews.title: It literally burned me, can not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this watch. However, after about two months of use it shut off without warning, rapidly began heating up, and burned my wrist before I could yank it off. I haven't turned back on, and it keeps cooling off and rapidly heating without any apparent pattern. Based on the smell that came from it, the electronics inside are heavily damaged, but I'm not about to try and open it. I would be giving this watch a five-star review if not for the whole 'risk of severe personal injury and fire' aspect. If you choose to buy it anyway, I'd recommend taking it off at night to limit risk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a touch screen
customer_reviews.text: I liked this watch real well, especially for the navigation that hooks up via Bluetooth to your phone. I'm on a motorcycle all the time and cannot look at my phone when I am trying to find an address or City or Street. The only part I didn't like, and I didn't know when I bought it, is that it is not a touch screen but I got over that pretty fast. The battery does last 5 to 8 days between charges depending on how much you use it. On Long motorcycle trips it will make a whole day at least using navigation before needing recharging.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I already have one of the in silver so I knew what I was getting. This one arrived in perfect condition with the original packaging (if not original then at least highly convincing!). The watch functions exactly as a Pebble should with waterproofing, fewer recharge times due to superior battery life, notifications about email and texts, and for me one of the key features is controlling the music on my phone from my watch. I can still do this with the original firmwear and Pebble app still connecting to the original website. Some people have migrated over to Rebble for updated apps and watch faces but I have all I need. Now I have two Pebbles. I love these watches
customer_reviews.author: K Dog

customer_reviews.title: I love this Watch it does everything thing an Apple Watch ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this Watch it does everything thing an Apple Watch does a a fraction of the cost. The battery lasts for at least 5 days without needed to be charged the Apple. Watch only lasts 1.5 days max. I like that the time is always showing on the Apple Watch it goes to sleep and you always have to push the button to wake it up. I have both Watches and I use my pebble steel more often and the bands are cheaper. Great buy and I'm not being paid or compensated in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, but easy to scratch the screen, and apps are buggy
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch. The features are great, and the styling is better than most smart watches. I do have a few problems, though: 1) Get a screen protector. This thing scratches very easily. It is nice that the screen protector also covers up the scratches, but in a week or so I did get 4 separate scratches. 2) Some of the apps available are pretty buggy, and it seems like updates won't happen, since the company was bought up. Most are usable, but they could do with an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Watch compromise of function, form and price
customer_reviews.text: With numerous reviews out there, I can only add that I feel this Pebble Watch is still the easiest to use, most functional smart watch on the market for the price. With always-on E-Ink display, 7-10 day battery life and the ability to receive and respond to text messages, Pebble does everything I want in a smart watch without frills, bulk, weight or a phone on my wrist. Fitbit's replacement may have better fitness monitoring but it doesn't do anything else as well. Thanks Fitbit, I'll stick with my Pebble.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S

customer_reviews.title: It's "Okay" but.....
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool watch. I didn't know Pebble went out of business, if I had known that I doubt I would have bought the watch. They no longer support their watches. Most functions still work though. Looks good, feels good. The watch face has too much wasted, non-screen area. I'm a big guy with large wrists and it still fits me (2 extra holes even!). This is my first Smartwatch and at the price not a horrible experiment so far. Haven't found any advantages to having it yet, needs to be within Bluetooth range of phone at all times. update, the band it comes with stains/marks too easily and really takes away from the way it looks..
customer_reviews.author: C. O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Watch For Me
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! I wish Pebble was still around, but still this thing fits my needs perfectly. It gets 10 days between charges so I don't need to worry about it; it's waterproof; it has apps for all the features I want (handling calls, messages, notifications, music, alarms, tracking steps and sleep, checking the weather) and works great on my Android phones. I use it so much I actually get better battery life from my phone because it can stay asleep in my pocket instead of waking up every few minutes to do everything. It has so many watch faces I never get bored with how I tell time.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Carner

customer_reviews.title: Better (IMHO) than Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: To bad the Pebble people sold out to Fitbit, this is a great watch. Fitbit has no plans to keep Pebble around, or to provide follow up service. I think they must have bought Pebble simply to get rid of worthy competition. Actually better than "worthy" as this watch outperforms anything Fitbit has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great little watch
customer_reviews.text: It is a complete shame that Pebble went out of business unfortunately I love their watches. Which is typical with my luck. In any case excellent watch I like the simple interface there is not a lot of complication where this watch is concerned. It absolutely does every function I needed to do without the high cost. And is damn near indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Whiteaker

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: One day, someone will build a smartwatch that's just as good as this one. My money is on 2022. If you're unaware and looking at buying one of these, realize that the manufacturer went out of business in late 2016, and as of now software support is only guaranteed until June 2018. After that, if Android APIs change and break compatibility, well, deal with it. You may still be able to make the Pebble work thanks to third party apps, but it will be a project.
customer_reviews.author: The Third Bird

customer_reviews.title: This one met the requirements and I'm happy to say that after one month of use she ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch for my daughter for Christmas. I ended up going with this watch over other brands including Apple because of the reviews I read on all different watches.My daughter works as a dog bather and needed a waterproof watch. This one met the requirements and I'm happy to say that after one month of use she loves it. I would definitely recommend this watch!
customer_reviews.author: Denise Laird

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic watch, only one complaint
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch, my one complaint would be that sometimes it reverts to the basic tic-toc watch face and I cannot change it to any of the new ones that I have downloaded without restarting and un-installing and re-installing the chosen watch face. Everything else works wonderfully and I am very happy with my purchase. Love the long battery life!
customer_reviews.author: Sam G.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit disappointed that it won't accept my speech to be able to respond to texts - seems there is a glitch and the directions provided with the watch do not give any information and the ap also isn't much help. 6 months after I started using this watch it now won't pair with my phone. I did a reset and now it is stuck on the getpebble.com/ap screen and won't do anything. I'm so upset because this watch is no longer supported as Pebble sold out to FitBit.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah VanSchoor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome basic smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. People think it's an apple watch all the time. Too bad pebble was bought out by fitbit tho 😑. So no more aoftware updates. Charge for an hour, lasts 5-7 days. Not the best graphics and non touch screen, but it's OK. I'll trade that for battery life. I love how it's a Spotify remote and easy to set up. Pebble health app is Cool, good to know how many hours of sleep and deep sleep I get every night, and how many steps I take in a day. It's my first smart watch and I wear it 24/7. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: No comparison
customer_reviews.text: First if all, ytou can't tell this was refurbished. It looks and acts brand new. Comparing it with Apple and Android watches shows there is no contest. The Pebble lasts 5-7 days on a charge while the Apple struggles to last even one day. The Android watches do little batter needing charging every day. The Pebble shows the time and whatever other data you choose all the time and a flick of the wrist calls up the back light. The others? You have to touch the watch face to see anything!
customer_reviews.author: James W. Gerber

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: Its obviously lacks the hearth rate monitor, but that can be easily replaced by a dedicated one, and since its not a feature on this device, but other than that its just what I wanted, I dont need to charge it every day, which was what I dreaded from other devices and it was what I needed, also, another interesting fact, at the moment I have a semi decent device, it sometimes struggles and thats why I dont check my cellphone that often, but with this device I can answer really quickly, and not only that, I dont need to open apps like whatsapp or facebook chat, which helps my cellphone battery life and usage.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch. Long lasting battery for a smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Excellent watch. Long lasting battery for a smart watch, snappy transition animations, and no screen tearing. Wrapping the watch is a near indestructible steel housing with super tough glass screen. Better than the original pebble watch, and thats saying alot for me (I have 3). I recommend this watch even with the high upfront cost, as pebble's signature "bone rattling" alarm has saved my ass an innumerable amount of time, battery life is great, excellent construction, and the bluetooth communication works really well. (I'm using ios for those who wanted to know)
customer_reviews.author: Cheesehead1

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed in it
customer_reviews.text: The vibrations used for notifications were so light, that I missed almost every text and message coming in. The screen was small and hard to see. I was disappointed in it. Also, there was not much clear information on the internet about setting it up and basic functions. I now have an Apple watch, and felt like the extra money spent, compared to the money spent on the Pebble Time Steel, was very worth it. I thought it was a pretty watch, but it wasn't very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley W. Seeley

customer_reviews.title: Great smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great smartwatch. I'm not a smartwatch guy - I love real watches, and I have a lot of them. Nor do I want a smartphone on my wrist. I want email, text, and calendar notifications. The weather is nice - that's it, and that's exactly what this watch does - and does it well. Plus 10 day battery life. It's a shame they were bought out by Fitbit and stopped production, which is why I got such a great price. Grab one while they're still available.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Schnittman

customer_reviews.title: Pebble Smart Watch
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the other Pebble watches in black, white and pink and wanted a nicer one to wear to work. This one fits the bill and is great. I've had many people ask if it's an Apple watch, which I can say no, but it's just as great and a lot less expensive. I would highly recommend this watch to anyone wanting a smart watch with basic functions.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Thaman

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed to find out that the watch works now but ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed to find out that the watch works now but is not updatable so limited function for the future. My husband was so disappointed that we had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: MeMe

customer_reviews.title: This watch is awesome. I had a Moto 360 and it was ...
customer_reviews.text: This watch is awesome. I had a Moto 360 and it was running out battery before I leave work in the afternoon. The screen was deteriorated less than one year. I ended up donating it to charity. This Pebble has battery power last more than a week, I can see the screen very clearly under direct sunlight, unlike other smart watch, the screen is always on. The watch is decently beautiful, on par with the Apple Watch and it has a great quality feel. I don't usually give a five start review but for this one, I am loving it.
customer_reviews.author: memasterac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Most smart choice Watch me writing was based ios android is very small. The best thing about the Pebble Steel is a time that you do charge more than just a once a week. KakaoTalk, phone, sms and alarm are both good, the costs very much like it because it tells a number of steps to push. I've decided to buy silver came the black charm just embarrassing.
customer_reviews.author: Cho

customer_reviews.title: Pebble is amazing. I wasn't sure if id like this watch ...
customer_reviews.text: Pebble is amazing. I wasn't sure if id like this watch over say android wear, but this is the best there is right now. The OS, the battery life, always on display and cant forget water proof! It has really made my every day experience much better and i feel less tied up with the phone and more free to do things without worrying that im missing a call or something. I recommend everyone get the new Pebble Time 2, or pebble 2 in SEPT/NOV. You wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: SUPER WATCH
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works great, Bought a different band as the light grey leather band that comes with it gets dirty quickly. I have been getting about 7-9 days per charge depending on how I use it. I have it connected to my Android phone about 14 hours a day. I have a Pebble Time that was getting 2-4 days per charge. Like this model a lot more. Unless you want a round watch this model is the one that I recommend to my friends that are looking for a smart watch.
customer_reviews.author: night player

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I need from a smart watch and 10 day battery life with always on display seals the deal. Such a shame Pebble are no longer trading. The strap is better than it appears in the product photo. I thought I was going to change it but it is well made and comfortable. I will keep it for now.
customer_reviews.author: JED

customer_reviews.title: Best Smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: The Pebble Time Steel is what a Smart Watch should be. I am a mechanic by trade so I need durability, but I also need something that is refined as well. Pebble Time Steel is that watch. I can read texts, change music, see my schedule for the day. Also, it doesn't prattle away with ridiculous noises, it only vibrates. With the associated screen protector it is truly amazing. Sadly, they were bought out by Fitbit, so these high quality products are dissipating, but being the fantastic company they are, the software is is being maintained.
customer_reviews.author: Kayto Al'Thor

customer_reviews.title: This device survived a trip through the washing machine. ...
customer_reviews.text: This device survived a trip through the washing machine. I am impressed. I do not think an apple watch would have held up as well.
customer_reviews.author: J2

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's not an apple watch, or a galaxy gear, I want to make that clear. But I didn't want one of those, I wanted something that could last for a few days, had no gimmicks and wouldn't be a massive distraction. This watch has fewer functions, but what it does, it does exceptionally well. The main issues at this point are simply because it's a young platform without many 3rd party developers making apps/peripherals for it, but that's changing quickly. Great construction, solid design.
customer_reviews.author: D Smith

customer_reviews.title: Get the peeble!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this watch! Its definitely been the best smart watch i could have ever had and now I wanna kick myself for not getting it sooner. However, the only thing I dont like about it is understanding all the settings. I get it set up the way I want it and then it changes again on me if I ever decide to change up the face, etc. But as far as battery life, notifications, bluetooth sync, etc. ..this is your watch for sure! I didnt have to even break the bank for it. I love my Peeble and highly recommend this one!!! Also, make sure you order new wrist bands too as the grey and lighter colors show wear/tear more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pebble has stopped making smart watches right what I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Pebble has stopped making smart watches right what I bought it. Had problems hooking it up to my wifes IPhoine 7, but hooked up smooth to my Samsung, althought it said it it was Iphone friendly...sent it back since they stopped making them
customer_reviews.author: tim mceuen

customer_reviews.title: Looks like new!
customer_reviews.text: It is a refurb, but looks brand new. Can't complain about that! As for the watch, it's way too complex to review in detail here. Suffice to say, if you like the Pebble Time Steel, you'll like this. It's just like new. Wish the color of the watch and band were different, but for $100 extra, I'll pass on the details! I put a black band on it and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Flyboyron

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: This is a garage watch. the customer support is worthless and email only and if I can get it to connect it only lasts a few months at a time before it fails the connection again. Oh and if you go through the steps to reset the connection you'll end up in some hazard mode which doesn't let you do anything on the watch. Costumer service is a joke. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Flyer22

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT! Works with my Pixel XL (Android 7.1.1 OS)
customer_reviews.text: Coming from the Galaxy Gear 1, this is an awesome watch! It has more features than most Android watches out there. Love love love it! Works just fine with Android 7.1.1. Edit: Still loving this watch. There are lots of customization options. It has a great business look to it, but you still looks good for pleasure with the customization options.
customer_reviews.author: tmcswain09

customer_reviews.title: Get it on sale...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Pebble Health.Respond to msgs.Wonderful size. Cons: Terrible watch band! My gold watch came with the red band and day 1 and the band looks old! Price i paid was reduced by alot 2 days after ordering. 11 Months Later: Still in love with my watch. Been using a black band. The red was just terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Smartwatch.
customer_reviews.text: This smart watch is amazing. I am sad to see Pebble go. Overall this Watch is worth every penny. The feedback is amazing. Vibrations work well, and the buttons are very clicky and make a good sound. 100% quality product. The leather band is soft-touch but is very durable. The only issue is that the charger disconnects easily, but I believe this is a safety feature. I did not have to contact the seller, so I cannot comment on that experience.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Boswell

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it! I wish I would get full 10 days on one charge, but the 7 day I do get is awesome!!! No touch screen is a plus! Low resolution display = low battery consumption, is a plus! Uncertainty regarding its future = lower pricing, is also a plus! I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sierto

customer_reviews.title: Its absolutely perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this watch. It does everything I want it to do. It is not a touch phone but it really doesn't matter! it's just to me that good, and for the price I gave, is unbelievable. I'm so sorry that Pebble does not exist and was bought out by Fitbit I believe, I really hope that Fitbit keeps this phone going because it will make them money. I would buy this over a Fitbit any day and it's cost is a fourth of the price, so grab them while you can, I'm going to get a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Birthday gift of win
customer_reviews.text: My husband got this for his birthday after his trusted Moto 360 died a horrible death from sweat and use. Replaced the band because one day of wear proved that it would not last. Watch has held up solidly and love the better life. He's also entertained by a Star Trek theme he found for it...
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Williams

customer_reviews.title: One of the best smartwatches out there.
customer_reviews.text: This watch works with most phones and looks good too. There isn't much to say about it other than that you should buy it if you are looking for one. Pros: - Many apps and watchfaces in store - 10 day battery life is above any other smartwatch - Screen is always on - Buttons make it easy to navigate without looking - Steel body feels good Cons: - Thick and heavy (look at the Pebble Time Round for the opposite) - Large bezel Overall, this is an extremely capable smartwatch that you should buy if you are looking into them.
customer_reviews.author: teddyfrozevelt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent condition for the price
customer_reviews.text: First smart watch user so I did lot of research and found I need a watch with longer better life. Pebble Time Steel lasts for 8-10 days depending on usage. Pebble has good finished products and get the things done. I get notifications for messages, whats app and more. Seller send the watch on time and in excellent condition. Very satisfied with the buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sonata 2011

customer_reviews.title: Why buy Pebble instead of the Apple Watch
customer_reviews.text: I considered the Apple Watch. But Pebble is better. Why? Here's why: - Battery Life is 5 to 7 days. DAYS. DAYYYYYYYYYYYSSSSSSSSSSS. - keeps the hour always on. - The alarm is AWESOME because it vibrates. Better than making noises. - Watchfaces are very nice. - It doesn't drain your iPhone's battery. That's enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Roque Junior

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It is not a touch screen but the three buttons on the right and one on the left work great. The battery life is excellent. It does have some issues with staying connected to my phone once every few weeks but I easily resolve it on my own. The feature I like most is the speech to text which I use often at work. I would recommend this product highly over an iWatch which costs much more.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: not touchscreen but love it. alarms setting to vibrate without waking up ...
customer_reviews.text: does it work, didnt have to spend lots of money in apple watch. not touchscreen but love it. alarms setting to vibrate without waking up my husband. all reminders everythong sync with my iphone.
customer_reviews.author: Tatty

customer_reviews.title: the hype is over, this WAS a huge thing a couple of years ago.
customer_reviews.text: the Pebbles were always a thing for me and I was excited to get my hands on this Time Steel edition. Overall not much to complain about, it performs as advertised, just we are clearly not in that era any more. it feels outdated with the retro pixel screen. on the other hand it has all you may want from a "wrist computer" especially with the fan "rebble" app replacing the now defunct pebble app.
customer_reviews.author: Szabolcs Molnar

customer_reviews.title: Love my gold pebble time steel
customer_reviews.text: I truly love the pebble time steel in gold. I thought the silver would be better but honestly I bought thinking hey it's only $80. So what's refurbished. Saved $60. Looks amazing.
customer_reviews.author: seanstr26m

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I tried the Time Steel
customer_reviews.text: I had a Pebble Steel and was debating replacing it or going with the Time Steel. I'm so glad I tried the Time Steel. Although the size is a bit larger, the watch itself felt much lighter on my wrist. The buttons on my old watch had died and it's great to have them working on this watch and enjoy all the benefits again. The reason I didn't give it that last star is because I am really disappointed in the watch band. It picks up lots of dirt and looks cheap and cheesy; I will definitely be upgrading to another band very soon. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Dittman

customer_reviews.title: Replaced this with my old smart watch. It works great.
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace ce my other smart watch. Was not really sure how this would work. And I am very happy with the product. I’ve had it for several months now and it works perfectly... syncs to my iPhone and charges pretty quickly. I love the step monitor and the timer. I only use it for steps, clock, timer and alarm.
customer_reviews.author: MISSISSIPPI QUEEN

customer_reviews.title: Great Semi-Smart Watch!
customer_reviews.text: I know that Pebble was bought out and they won't be making any more products directly; but I bought this anyway. I am SUPER happy with it. The battery lasts from 4-7 days, the step counter and sleep tracker is great. It's perfect if you're like me and want a semi-smart watch that doesn't need charging everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Greg W.

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, Pebble!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Pebble as an alternative to ho-hum performance from a Moto 360 and a long string of malfunctioning FitBit's. I've been extremely satisfied with the Pebble's user interface, apps and battery performance. So sad that the company is no longer in business. They definitely built a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: My First
customer_reviews.text: Liked and still like this watch. Have replaced but not because of anything special just needed a watch that had more features.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Classy gold rimmed Pebble chrome watch!
customer_reviews.text: I much prefer this to my wife’s substantially more expensive Apple I watch as it has all the functions I want or need and is much simpler to use!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Miller

customer_reviews.title: A huge improvement from Pebble Time.
customer_reviews.text: I had owned a Pebble OG, Pebble Time, and now this Pebble Time Steel. This is an excellent watch with 8-9 days battery life. The screen is very good, vibrant and better contrast than Pebble Time. I was surprised by the improvement they made on side buttons. The buttons were not mushy like Pebble Time. All 4 buttons had enough travel and feedback one expected when these buttons were pressed. Overall I'm so happy with this Pebble Time Steel and hope it last and doesn't give me problem down the road as there will be no warranty since Pebble is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin Yam Chun Seong

customer_reviews.title: Been using for over a year
customer_reviews.text: Still works great. Only thing I've had to do is replace the band due to outside sources breaking it. For what it costs, it's an effective watch
customer_reviews.author: Drako

customer_reviews.title: Near-perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased right after the announcment of Pebble Time 2 will not be release and it is the best one I made this year. This watch is amazing, well-built and it is everything a smartWATCH should be: a great looking watch that can deliver notifications and USEFUL apps to your wrist for a whole week with a single charge, with independent OS that works well with both iPhone and Android (and the geeky animations are just too lovley!). It only lacks HR monitor and GPS (that can be achieved with the "PAL GPS-smartstrap") to become PERFECT.
customer_reviews.author: Aviv

customer_reviews.title: ... a very capable replacement for some of the other smart watches available
customer_reviews.text: this is a very capable replacement for some of the other smart watches available. It does a lot and the battery life is amazing! It is water resistant. I took showers and was caught in the rain with no worries. I did return the item because while swimming in a pool, it quit working. Im going to buy another soon.
customer_reviews.author: Old School Marcster

customer_reviews.title: Gone to soon
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loves the watch. He usually doesn't hear his phone go off because he has it on vibrate for work but with the watch he doesn't miss a call or text. No more excuses for you didn't hear your phone. LOL. So sad that they are no longer going to have them and support them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy customer!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for a few months now. I have a very small and bony wrist and this smartwatch is very comfortable to wear and it stays in place. The watch is made very well and informs me when I have a call or message by buzzing my arm. I'm very happy with my purchase and recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent smart watch
customer_reviews.text: Interface is an upgrade from the Pebble Steel but takes some getting used to. For if being the Time Steel, the watch screen seems a little cheap (made of plastic?). I love the watch though and find myself lost without it. Battery life is amazing, I average 7 days before getting to 10%. Quick to charge but magnetic charger doesn't stay well and has a tendency to fall out, band is easy to change, but comes with nice leather band.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Rakoczy

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price but it is pretty basic. You get the time and notifications. The app does not work anymore
customer_reviews.author: YC

customer_reviews.title: but I am well pleased with the watch
customer_reviews.text: I received my pebble time steel about a week ago. It took me a while to get it paired, but I am well pleased with the watch. I am using the step app to get up and get moving and I also like the sleep feature.
customer_reviews.author: W. R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I was really excited to get the pebble steal. ...
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get the pebble steal. Unfortunatly i was not able to get an exercise app to connect to my Humana 365 account . Misfit wouldn't sync to my pebble. I was very dissapointed to have to return the pebble.
customer_reviews.author: Annie    22

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: For the money you can't go wrong easy to setup and works with my IPhone with no issues. Only draw back so far is that if you forget to clear notifications watch will reboot and do so for you. I was worried it would not stand up to the abuse of being worn while out at the range but has stood up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you have android
customer_reviews.text: Naked without it. So much better than wasting money on Apple watch or Samsung gear... it has the basics of what you need Update- works better with android than with apple. I’m in the market for an Apple watch now
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with all it can do
customer_reviews.text: I had an original Pebble watch before purchasing this. I have to say, it is a classy upgrade over the original and just as functional. Very happy with all it can do...I can even open and close my garage door using just my watch now! Pretty cool! Batter lasts for days between charges, easy to use and never disconnects; even at some great distances. Love my Pebble Time Steel!
customer_reviews.author: P. Starr

customer_reviews.title: Simplicity at its finest
customer_reviews.text: I have been using pebble since they launched, This is more refined but keeping the pebble simplicity. Holds a charge most of the week with moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Guardian239

customer_reviews.title: Great smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: The best smartwatch out there. It may not be touch screen or have fancy graphics but it tracks steps, shows calls, messages and texts and even tells the weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best smart watch in the market
customer_reviews.text: This smart watch may not have a touch screen, but it's easily the best watch on the market right now. Easily competes with the price point of the Apple Watch, while providing a 10 day battery life. I would reccommend this watch to anyone looking for a smart watch. This is the best investment I've made in a long time. I do have to say that I dislike the leather band that comes with it, just the watch band is easily replaceable with a silicon band or a metal band.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.

customer_reviews.title: Water = Steel Paper Weight
customer_reviews.text: So this was my second pebble watch I have owned. I had the original pebble steel as well. This watch worked great for two months... until I took it to the pool. I wore my Pebble Time Steel into the pool, just as its rated to do. Shortly after entering the pool I noticed my watch was black, and sure enough it's dead as a door nail. The good news is it comes with a 1 year warranty, right? WRONG - Pebble no longer honors anything. So I have an expensive paper weight. Yay.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Pebble smart watch tech, way underrated!!!
customer_reviews.text: Much better and greater visibility than the basic Time model. It captures ambient light better due to the full face glass crystal. In addition mine has enough power to last longer than 10 days on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: john cray

customer_reviews.title: Solid and dependable watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid watch and met all my expectations. It's excellent for keeping track of your steps and sleep pattern. It paired seamlessly with my iPhone once the appropriate apps were installed. The only drawbacks are it doesn't have touch screen capability and I can't answer my phone via my watch, but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Choice of Limited Watch Features
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch. I especially like the long battery life, multiple watch displays, and not having a touch screen display. It's a great choice of features. I don't miss having a touch screen display and annoying audio sound(s). You quickly get used to having to use the four buttons for everything, and the choice of vibrations easily wakes you up in the morning. No more going to a meeting or class, and having your watch go off unexpectedly! What a great choice of features. Please keep support for the watch app!
customer_reviews.author: Dominick DeVincenzo

customer_reviews.title: Pebble still is the best
customer_reviews.text: Still the best watch years after going out of business. Rebble will get all the functionality back.
customer_reviews.author: L4nner

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!
customer_reviews.text: Best watch ever! Tried 3 different fitbit. Didn't like having to turn my watch to try and see the time. Excellent battery life. I only wanted steps, text notifications, and time. It does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Its OK
customer_reviews.text: I use this with an iPhone 6s plus. Bluetooth and Bluetooth LE connections are unreliable. Settings change with every update. I still haven't been able to get the find my phone feature to work on any phone.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: i love the watch
customer_reviews.text: i love the watch, but 3 months later the charger broke and it's been trial and error trying to get a new charger. either incorrect version ordered, or they burn out quickly. I wish i purchased a different watch honestly.
customer_reviews.author: karen e.

customer_reviews.title: I love this smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I love this smart watch, it might not have the bright touch screen display of an I-watch, but because of that, battery will last 4-5 days easily. it takes a lil bit of time to figure and set up all the apps needed for a full "smart" experience (too many options), but its worthy once you get it running! I don't know what's going to happen now that the company got sold to Fitbit but I hope we can migrate and make use of new apps and updates.
customer_reviews.author: LLBr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing watch
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is what puts this above the rest. If you want a watch first and "data second", then this is for you. It's not flash, but has the right combination of features to make it perfect for those who don't want a "smartphone wrapped around their wrist". This is a very well thought out User Interface and I think it's in it's own category of smartwatches.
customer_reviews.author: TomAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Could be a 5 star purchase, but I probably got a lemon
customer_reviews.text: When I received the Pebble for my wife as a gift, we intended to give it a 5 star rating: Great battery life (over a week), water resistance, and stylish look. However, the screen start flickering in a bout a week, and then it just not showing anything on-and-off, so I have to return it. Well, perhaps, I just being unlucky and get a lemon. If you have better luck than me, you may have a great smart watch that is much better than the current Android wear or apple watch on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was so excited to get this watch. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this watch. I ordered it, got it set up how I wanted it, and within 4 hours the screen went black. After pressing buttons, I got a white screen. Tried resetting and several other tricks, then noticed based on reviews of "the screen of death" that this issue is ongoing and is not fixable since Fitbit bought out Pebble. Very unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer :)
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Wish it had a speaker so I could get calls...but it pairs nicely with my phone and bluetooth earpiece. The tan colored band that comes with it is super cheap, so good thing I also bought a black (Barton) and stainless band (Vetoo). You should offer the silver watch with a black band...my 2 cents. ;) Arrived early, happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Get one
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! I was looking for a while at smart watches and didn't really think I was going to buy into them cause of price and the fact that you had to charge it every day. I wasn't sure I would enjoy killing my phone battery and watch every day. This thing takes like 5 minutes to charge. Every 4-5 days while I'm in the shower I charge it and it lasts forever and that's with using it a ton. I really like how you can change the bands just by ordering an off brand one too. This thing is simple, very quick, easy to use and great on battery. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Best decision ever!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Couldn't bring myself to pay 400.00 for a Apple Watch. Glad I didn't as the Pebble Time Steel has surpassed my expectations. I bought a Apple Watch for a friend at Chistmas, (during a sale) and her biggest complaint is the very short battery life. I've had my Pebble for three days, and have not charged it yet! Lots of compliments, very stylish!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Pierson

customer_reviews.title: I still love the Pebble
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I have tried and used many smart watches, however with a 7 day(pebble claims 10 day) battery life, no ther smart watch even comes close. I dont need the fancy, gymicky android wear or apple watch. This fits my needs perfectly as an extension of my phone, so i dont have to pull out my phone when i get a message, notification etc. A real shame Pebble has ceased to exist as a company.
customer_reviews.author: J W

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: this is a great little watch for its price point. can't compare it to other smart watches in functionality but it does everything you need it to do. notifications, basic music control, pedometer and sleep tracker. There's not a whole lot else you can do with such a small screen. The pebble does all these basic things and it does it well.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Great, but not quite as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Battery is like 3 days, but I'm a very heavy user, brightness maxed and constantly checking it with weather in the background. It has pretty good features such as sleep monitor and a step counter. I like it. *edit* at work today and the wrist band snapped on me! Both are broken and im gonna superglue them until my next paycheck where I can get a decent one. Dissapointed to say the least
customer_reviews.author: Hunter K.

customer_reviews.title: Great smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, feels great in my wrist but after couple of uses at work the leather gets very stained so I decide to buy a rubber one and left the leather just for special occasions. Works great with my iPhone 6S (notifications, text etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Janboricua

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like it much
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like it much because it's broke after few months.. I got red stain of that watch band so didn't use for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sujata

customer_reviews.title: Peebles no longer selling smart watches
customer_reviews.text: I tried setting up my Pebble watch to find out these watches were no longer being sold since 12/6/16 and want to know what I am to do now
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Burns

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than any other tec watch. I swim with mine
customer_reviews.author: william renz

customer_reviews.title: Pebble Time Steel Smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: I like the watch. Takes a little to learn how to work it. My only problem is that the text on the face is quite small. Not to easy to read for us older people. Works great with my I-phone and is waterproof so it can be on my wrist through everything that I do in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Guerriero

customer_reviews.title: I love my watch
customer_reviews.text: I love my watch. I get so many compliments and inquiries about it. Most think it's one of the more expensive brands. My only issue is that the Bluetooth connection requires a reset too often.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Could not get past the dim screen, otherwise very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I did enjoy the features, especially notifications. Great selection of watch faces. Watch is intuitive to use. But I sent it back because the screen was just too dim.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy70

customer_reviews.title: that doesn't seem like a difficult task
customer_reviews.text: The band started to wear down immediately, and there have already been moments when the watch has needed to reboot itself. It reboots when asking to dismiss messages...that doesn't seem like a difficult task.
customer_reviews.author: isaiah17_7

customer_reviews.title: Second one I owned great.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pebble, this is the second one I owned and if it works as well as the first one I will be very happy. The only problem I possibly see is the charging cable is on the back so I can't charge it while wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best Smartwatch
customer_reviews.text: This is the best smart watch company out there. The gold looks super clean. The battery life is excellent. And I love the voice dictation. I have bought a pebble for all my friends and family
customer_reviews.author: Nate

product_meta.title: Pebble Time Steel Smartwatch for Apple/Android Devices - Black
product_meta.description: Pebble time steel keeps you connected to the things that matter most, and look great doing it. Its unparalleled battery lasts up to 10 days between charges, and its bright always-on display never keeps you waiting. Pebble's new timeline interface respects that busy people want to Get things done. Includes Pebble health, a Built-in activity and sleep tracker with daily reports and Weekly insights. With a new color e-paper screen and a thin, comfortable ergonomic design, the Pebble time steel smartwatch is the companion you'll want with you every moment, every day. Made of marine grade stainless steel chassis and bezel, pvd Coated in matte with polished detailing, Plus tough, 2.5D glass display - time steel is the best looking Pebble we've ever made! includes: USB Magnetic charging cable 2mm Leather band
feature_bullets: Notifications at a glance: calendar events, text and emails, incoming calls, and more.
Includes Pebble Health, a built-in activity and sleep tracker with daily reports and Weekly insights.
Always on, Color e-paper display with LED backlight; water resistant to 30 meters; battery life up to 10 days
Built-in microphone for voice notes and quick replies
Choose from thousands of Custom watch faces in the Pebble app store, with more added every day

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,062 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
